1.text: Ephraim feedeth on wind, and pursueth after the east wind: all day long he multiplieth lies and desolation; and they make a covenant with Assyria, and oil is carried into Egypt.

2.text: Jehovah hath also a controversy with Judah, and he will punish Jacob according to his ways; according to his doings will he recompense him.

3.text: He took his brother by the heel in the womb, and in his strength he wrestled with God.

4.text: Yea, he wrestled with the Angel, and prevailed; he wept, and made supplication unto him: he found him in Bethel, and there he spoke with us,

5.text: —even Jehovah, the God of hosts,—Jehovah is his memorial.

6.text: And thou, return unto thy God: keep loving-kindness and judgment, and wait on thy God continually.

7.text: [He is] a merchant, balances of deceit are in his hand; he loveth to oppress.

8.text: And Ephraim saith, Nevertheless I am become rich, I have found me out substance; in all my labours they shall find none iniquity in me that were sin.

9.text: But I [that am] Jehovah thy God from the land of Egypt will again make thee to dwell in tents, as in the days of the solemn feast.

10.text: And I have spoken to the prophets, and I have multiplied visions, and by means of the prophets have I used similitudes.

11.text: If Gilead is iniquity, surely they are but vanity: they sacrifice bullocks in Gilgal; yea, their altars are as heaps in the furrows of the fields.

12.text: And Jacob fled into the country of Syria, and Israel served for a wife, and for a wife he kept [sheep].

13.text: And by a prophet Jehovah brought Israel out of Egypt, and by a prophet was he preserved.

14.text: Ephraim provoked [him] to anger most bitterly; and his Lord shall leave his blood upon him, and recompense unto him his reproach.
